question:
Planting trees is very important for the environment. Some people says trees should be planted in the vacant areas of cities and towns, while other says housing facilities should be buld instead.
 Do you agree or disagree?
text: There is no doubt that these days modernity and pollution has a huge impact across the globe. Many countries begin to establish more houses and parks for their citizens. Some people claimed that plantation is essential for any nation. Whilst others argued that building residential units is more crucial. In this essay, I am going to discuss both of these views and draw my own conclusion

On the one hand, plantation has a major impact on environment by declining the rates of the atmosphere pollution. In other words, building parks and encourage farmers to plant in different areas of the country could be beneficial for inhabitant's health. As a shining example, a recent study has been published by King Saud University states that children who grew in rural villages have less health problems than the ones who lived in capital or main cities.

On the other flip of the coin. Some governments begins to provide residential facilities which leads to a wide variety of positive consequences. Firstly, housing mitigates the overpopulated pressure on the major cities. Secondly, it promotes plethora of opportunities to low income employees and labors to find a suitable houses for their families. In other words, building residential houses and compounds provide more options to people and aid them to purchase their own property.

In conclusion, although there is an argument about the importance of the occurrence of forests in countryside for citizens and environment , while another claim says that housing services is more needed. Therefore, I strongly believe that housing  have numerous reasons to be on the government's priorities list.

error_list.error_des: The verb has does not seem to agree with the subject. Consider changing the verb form.
The noun phrase plantation seems to be missing a determiner before it. Consider adding an article.
The noun phrase environment seems to be missing a determiner before it. Consider adding an article.
It seems that there is an article usage problem here.
It appears that your sentence or clause uses an incorrect form of the verb encourage. Consider changing it.
It seems that inhabitant's may not agree in number with other words in this phrase.
It seems that preposition use may be incorrect here.
It appears that the quantifier less does not fit with the countable noun problems. Consider changing the quantifier or the noun.
It seems that there is an article usage problem here.
The singular verb begins does not appear to agree with the plural subject governments. Consider changing the verb form for subject-verb agreement.
The singular verb leads does not appear to agree with the plural subject residential facilities. Consider changing the verb form for subject-verb agreement.
The noun phrase plethora seems to be missing a determiner before it. Consider adding an article.
It seems that preposition use may be incorrect here.
It appears that low income is missing a hyphen. Consider adding the hyphen(s).
The spelling of labors is a non-British variant. For consistency, consider replacing it with the British English spelling.
The indefinite article a may not be required with the plural noun houses in this sentence. Consider removing the article, or changing the noun to singular.
It seems that the verb provide does not agree with the subject. Consider changing the verb form.
It seems that preposition use may be incorrect here.
It seems that the verb aid does not agree with the subject. Consider changing the verb form.
The noun phrase countryside seems to be missing a determiner before it. Consider adding an article.
It seems that there is an article usage problem here.
It seems that conjunction use may be incorrect here.
The singular verb is does not appear to agree with the plural subject housing services. Consider changing the verb form for subject-verb agreement.
The plural verb have does not appear to agree with the singular subject housing. Consider changing the verb form for subject-verb agreement.
